entries: When you hit with an unreliable weapon, instead of adding an ability modifier to damage rolls, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the same type.

This magic weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d4} damage of its type when it is used to attack a beast with a swimming speed. Any beast damaged in this way remains pristine and fully intact for the sake of cooking and consuming.
You cannot knock a creature out with this axe. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the Undertaker's Axe, you chop off their head, or another equivalent body part, if any.
{@i A weapon furnished with platinum and gold, giving it a regal presence. It shines brighter in the hands of those with great conviction.}

entries.name: Glory Strike
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with this weapon, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} Radiant damage. This extra damage is not doubled by the {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.
{@i This weapon is made from Frostine crystals, a cream colored gemstone that is perpetually cold.}
This weapon is cold enough to keep the temperature within 5 feet of it at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (0 degrees Celsius). It deals Cold damage instead of its normal type.
{@i A set of armor made out of pure Frostine crystals.}

This armor is cold enough to keep the temperature within 5 feet of it at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (0 degrees Celsius). While wearing this armor you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage and automatically pass any saves against cold weather.
A creature wearing the armor can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|FTD} (DC 14). This property of the armor can't be used again until the next dawn.
